1.text: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the LORD.

2.text: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the LORD weighs the spirits.

3.text: Commit your works to the LORD, and your thoughts shall be established.

4.text: The LORD has made all things for himself: yes, even the wicked for the day of evil.

5.text: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.

6.text: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.

7.text: When a man’s ways please the LORD, he makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.

8.text: Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.

9.text: A man’s heart devises his way: but the LORD directs his steps.

10.text: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresses not in judgment.

11.text: A just weight and balance are the LORD’s: all the weights of the bag are his work.

12.text: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.

13.text: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaks right.

14.text: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.

15.text: In the light of the king’s countenance is life; and his favor is as a cloud of the latter rain.

16.text: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!

17.text: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keeps his way preserves his soul.

18.text: Pride goes before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.

19.text: Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.

20.text: He that handles a matter wisely shall find good: and whoever trusts in the LORD, happy is he.

21.text: The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increases learning.

22.text: Understanding is a wellspring of life to him that has it: but the instruction of fools is folly.

23.text: The heart of the wise teaches his mouth, and adds learning to his lips.

24.text: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

25.text: There is a way that seems right to a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

26.text: He that labors labors for himself; for his mouth craves it of him.

27.text: An ungodly man digs up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.

28.text: A fraudulent man sows strife: and a whisperer separates chief friends.

29.text: A violent man entices his neighbor, and leads him into the way that is not good.

30.text: He shuts his eyes to devise fraudulent things: moving his lips he brings evil to pass.

31.text: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.

32.text: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that rules his spirit than he that takes a city.

33.text: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the LORD.
